intro: Hibiscus anisostegius, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, velvety texture. Hibiscus anisostegius thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking blooms and adaptability to various climates.
